meanings.definition: To surpass in preaching or public speaking.
meanings.sent1: She outpreaches all the other speakers at the conference.
meanings.sent2: The pastor outpreaches his colleagues with his powerful sermons.
meanings.sent3: The young girl outpreaches her nervousness and delivers a confident speech.
meanings.sent4: His passion for the topic outpreaches any lack of experience he may have.
meanings.sent5: The motivational speaker outpreaches the doubts of the audience with her inspiring words.

meanings.definition: To speak more effectively or persuasively than others.
meanings.sent1: He outpreaches his competitors in the sales pitch.
meanings.sent2: The politician outpreaches his opponents with his compelling arguments.
meanings.sent3: The comedian outpreaches the awkward silence with a well-timed joke.
meanings.sent4: Her sincerity outpreaches any scripted speech she could have given.
meanings.sent5: The teacher outpreaches the distractions in the classroom with engaging lessons.
